### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)

• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.  
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.  
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.  
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research (current status: NO_POWER).  
  – An attempted solar panel placement to power the lab was not completed due to inventory and research issues.  
• Electricity Group comprising:
  – Small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).  
  – Merged network poles include a pole at (x=-17.5, y=13.5) and one at (x=-17.5, y=16.5) (the latter installed in step 1266 for the steam engine connection).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network:
  – Group 1: positions (x=-10.5, y=16.5) and (x=-12.5, y=18.5)  
  – Group 2: positions (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5)
• Steam Engines:
  – Steam engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=16.5)  
  – Steam engine at (x=-14.5, y=13.5) connected via the pole at (x=-17.5, y=13.5)

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Candidate and Buildable Validation:
 – Validate candidate positions for electrical components by ensuring sufficient clearance and confirming that no other entities occupy the intended placement tile.
 
• Pole Placement Conflicts:
 – When placing small electric poles near labs or steam engines, precheck for collisions with existing poles or other fixed structures. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions as needed.
 
• Variable and Assignment Errors:
 – Ensure that newly placed entities are correctly assigned to variables before using them in subsequent operations.
 
• General Resource and Connection Management:
 – Pre-calculate material requirements and verify inventory levels before initiating pipe connections or crafting processes.
 – Confirm the availability of all required ingredients prior to starting production processes.
 
• Electrical Network Merge:
 – Verify that target tiles for merging electrical components are unoccupied. Maintain an adequate supply of poles to support network expansions.
 
• Lab Power Connection:
 – If the lab remains unpowered, reassess proximity constraints and consider alternative connection methods or additional power-supplying components.
 
• Solar Panel and Technology Research:
 – Confirm that solar panels are present in the inventory before attempting placement.
 – Ensure prerequisite technologies (such as optics) are researched to unlock the solar panel recipe.
 – Fully satisfy all research prerequisites to avoid failures in both crafting and placement of solar panels.
 
• Automation Science Pack Crafting:
 – Verify that all sub-ingredients (for example, copper plates) required for crafting automation science packs are available and that necessary production facilities (such as operating furnaces) are in place.
 
• Additional Electric Pole Placement:
 – Before placing an additional electric pole near the lab, check that the intended position is unoccupied. Adjust spacing or the placement direction to avoid conflict with existing entities.
